name: InterContinental Kiev

reviews.text: I stayed here for the second time in May 2013 and was just as impressed as first time. I think this is a great hotel with excellent standards in everything from cleanliness to style. It is rather expensive but you get what you pay for - just as much in Kiev as anywhere else. If you want a top class Kiev hotel with excellent food and facilities than the Intercontinental is the one to go for. There is nothing negative I could possible say about it. Strongly recommended.
reviews.title: Consistent high standards

reviews.text: I travel a lot in the world, and I know what I am talking about, so:
reviews.title: Kyiv Intercont: Another hotel could be cheaper, but same or better I think not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure, this hotel has also his negative views, for example a forgetful Roomservice --> Minibar, but not really more what could be uncomfortable in all the 5 months of my stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Great choice for Kiev hotel

reviews.text: And no, I am not an Oligarch, who got a better treatment ;-)
reviews.title: The best choice in Kyiv!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfastservice in the morning is very good, very polite and offers a few languages to communicate.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: A lot of people will probably try to decide between the Hyatt and the Intercontinental. Having stayed at both multiple times, I would say if the price is the same, then the Hyatt just wins, but it is often 100 euros more per night. Here is the breakdown comparing the hotels using the same basic types of rooms (assuming you are not a higher level with either loyalty program and there are no specials running).
reviews.title: The Intercontinental verus the Hyatt

reviews.text: Price: Intercontinental is about 100 euros cheaper on average per night. Not always, but frequently so. You'll also have to factor in Internet and occasional mini-bar soft drinks if you are likely to drink them (see below)
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Winner: Intercontinental
reviews.title: Worth the expense

reviews.text: Room: Standard rooms are about the same size with some slight variations. Views can be unpredictable in both unless you upgrade. Internet is free at Intercontinental, but not free at the Hyatt. Soft drinks are free in the minibar at the Intercontinental (watch the hype of there use of 'free mini-bar' as it does not include alcohol). Hyatt charges international hotel prices, so expect over $5 for a coke. No alcohol in room at Intercontinental and no extras like nuts. Hyatt has good selection, even if they are pricey.
reviews.title: Shockingly good service, looks better than in pictures

reviews.text: Hyatt is slightly noisier with noise faintly penetrating the walls on some visits (maybe people just have more noisier sex there). . Some noise can drift up from foyer.Also, high floors facing St Sophia can get furniture floor noise from bars above. In room furniture feels more comfortable/plush at the Intercontinental and is generally peaceful.
reviews.title: Breakfast is a must!

reviews.text: This is a typical Intercontinental hotel. Smart lobby with a grand chandelier, comfortable rooms that are fully equipped. Free wifi. The only downside was that my room was facing into an internal space looking out at other bedroom windows. No view and not much light even though I was on the 9th floor. By craning your neck you could check the sky to see what the weather was like. It must be even darker on the floors below. I got the impression that a lot of the rooms must have this issue. On the plus side the hotel; could not be better located, next to St Michaels and a couple of minutes form Santa Sophia
reviews.title: Smart Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: Hotel is well located and most of the sites downtown are just walking distance. Comfortable, luxury & clean rooms, efficient air conditioning. Complimentary mini bar with replaced beverages daily. I just had to be careful with taking shower as water was easily getting out through the glass door and within seconds was bathroom floor filled by water. This was I was staying in this hotel 3 times and every single time I was highly satisfied. Hotel rates could be slightly lower, today they are above average but this is more related to hotel rates in Kiev.
reviews.title: Top hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: The hotel is well located next to many restaurants, close to the craft market and art galleries, in front of Saint Michael's cathedral and 10 minutes away from Khreshatyk (walking). The service is really good, rooms are good size and there is a small gym and pool to exercise. They have a spa but we didn't use it. We use the pool and my kids loved it because they have some floaters and noodles to play. The water was slighlty cold but the pool has a good size for swiming. The food was really good and there are many options in the room service menu. The atmosfere is very formal and decoration is ostentatious. The only negative point was parking, no valet when we arrived, we had to park ourself and the entrance to the parking lot is extremely narrow. When we left, we were delayed because we needed to stamp the parking receipt (we were not told of this at arrival). Everything else meet our expectations. Breakfast was full of options and the view from the room was beautiful.
reviews.title: Good service, beautiful building and good location

reviews.text: The Inter-Continental is a great hotel. I was in Kyiv for two days on business and stayed there two nights. I arrived early on Monday and they were able to get me into my room immediately. The room was spacious and clean. I really appreciated the complimentary mini-bar (no alcohol) which held cold soft drinks, water (with and without "gas") and fruit juice. I had lunch with a colleague the first day, took a nap in the afternoon and then walked around the city in the evening. I didn't feel like going out for dinner, so ordered room service. The food was delivered promptly and was absolutely delicious. It did not taste like the bland room service food that I am used to on trips.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great staff, super location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The business center was open late, all the equipment worked and there was a staff member available if I needed him.
reviews.title: Lovely property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed a refreshing iced cappuccino with a decadent dollop of vanilla ice cream and complimentary small biscuits. A Beautiful presentation. Great service in a lovely garden terrace setting far away from the crowds of St Sofia square. Simply lovely!
reviews.title: Great location in the center of the city

reviews.text: This is a centrally situated hotel and is close to the outdoor paining market and the cathedrals. The fruit basket that was in my room was superb (I guzzled most of it). And the hotel lobby is nice with an elegant chandelier.
reviews.title: Genuinely Nice Staff.

reviews.text: And yet...
reviews.title: Business stay; very nice

reviews.text: The mini-bar has hardly anything in it (and no alcohol!). The TV in my room was directly in front of the bed and could not be moved - you can only see it from the bed! How ridiculous is that?
reviews.title: Central and luxurious

reviews.text: Despite this nuisances, the cheeseburger that I ordered was excellent and the amenities (soaps, lotions etc) are what one would expect from an Intercon
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location...

description: Situated in the very heart of ancient Kiev and next to three main Ukrainian orthodox churches—St. Sophia, St. Michael and St. Andrew—the location of the InterContinental Kiev is truly unique. Built to match its historical surroundings, the hotel’s traditional style is grand and elegant. Business travellers will appreciate our proximity to corporate entities, government agencies and embassies. When it’s time for leisure, a wealth of shopping, historical and cultural sights are nearby including the Opera House, Khreschatyk (Kiev Main Street) and the Museum of Eastern and Western Art. Spread across 11 floors on the Dnipro River and City Wings, 272 rooms including 7 suites offer you pure relaxation in traditional surroundings.
